quote: To a philosopher all news, as it is called, is gossip, and they who edit it and read it are old women over their tea.
A real Christian is a person who can give his pet parrot to the town gossip.
All literature is gossip.
Conversation is three women stand on the corner talking. Gossip is when one of them leaves.
Fire and swords are slow engines of destruction, compared to the tongue of a Gossip.
Gossip is charming! History is merely gossip. But scandal is gossip made tedious by morality.
Gossip is news running ahead of itself in a red satin dress.
Gossip is only the lack of a worthy memory.
Gossip is the art of saying nothing in a way that leaves practically nothing unsaid.
Gossip is the opiate of the oppressed.
Gossip is what no one claims to like, but everybody enjoys.
Gossip is when you hear something you like about someone, you don't.

It's an indulgence to sit in a room and discuss your beliefs as if they were a juicy piece of gossip.
Journalism is organized gossip.
Scandal: gossip made tedious by morality.
So live that you wouldn't be ashamed to sell the family parrot to the town gossip.
The only time people dislike gossip is when you gossip about them.
The only time people dislike gossip is when you gossip about them.
Gossip is nature's telephone.
